workflow.name: Automated competitor price monitoring with Bright Data & n8n
workflow.description:
# 

## Description

This workflow automatically monitors your competitors' product prices and notifies you of any changes. It helps you stay competitive in the market by providing real-time insights into pricing strategies without manual checking.

## Overview

This workflow automatically tracks your competitors' pricing across their websites and notifies you of any changes. It uses Bright Data to scrape pricing data and can generate reports or send alerts when prices change.

### Tools Used

*   **n8n:** The automation platform that orchestrates the workflow.
*   **Bright Data:** For scraping competitor websites without being blocked.
*   **Spreadsheets/Databases:** For storing and analyzing price data.
*   **Notification Services:** For alerting you to significant price changes.

## How to Install

1.  **Import the Workflow:** Download the `.json` file and import it into your n8n instance.
2.  **Configure Bright Data:** Add your Bright Data credentials to the Bright Data node.
3.  **Set Up Data Storage:** Configure where you want to store the price data.
4.  **Customize:** Add your competitors' URLs and the specific products to monitor.

## Use Cases

*   **E-commerce Businesses:** Stay competitive with real-time price monitoring.
*   **Pricing Analysts:** Automate data collection for pricing strategy.
*   **Retailers:** Adjust your pricing strategy based on market trends.

---

## Connect with Me

*   **Website:** [https://www.nofluff.online](https://www.nofluff.online)
*   **YouTube:** [https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos](https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos)
*   **LinkedIn:** [https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/)
*   **Get Bright Data:** [https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25](https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25) (Using this link supports my free workflows with a small commission)

#n8n #automation #pricing #competitoranalysis #brightdata #ecommerce #pricemonitoring #competitiveintelligence #pricetracking #marketanalysis #n8nworkflow #workflow #nocode #pricingstrategy #competitortracking #ecommercetools #pricecomparison #businessintelligence #marketresearch #competitivepricing #retailautomation #pricealerts #datadriven #webscraping #pricinganalysis #competitorinsights

parameters.message:
=

Hi Team,

This is an automated alert to inform you that the pricing page of a competitor has changed.

  • Competitor: Wix
  • Page URL: https://www.wix.com/upgrade/website
  • Checked On: {{ $now }}

Please review the new pricing to assess if any strategic adjustments are needed. Please check in Google sheets for the latest pricing as soon as possible

Best regards,
Muhammad Shahkar
parameters.subject: Competitor Pricing Page Has Changed

parameters.content:
## üü¢ **SECTION 1: Fetch the Latest Pricing Info**

### üì° Scheduled Scraping Using Bright Data

| üß© Nodes Involved                   | üí¨ Description                                                                                                                                               |
| ----------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| üïí **Check Pricing Every Hour**     | This **Schedule Trigger** runs your workflow automatically (e.g., every hour). You don‚Äôt have to manually check the website.                                 |
| üåê **Fetch Page via Bright Data**   | Uses **Bright Data Web Unlocker API** to bypass bot protections and fetch the HTML of the pricing page from a competitor site (e.g., Wix, Squarespace, etc). |
| üßæ **Extract HTML Content**         | This node pulls out the actual **HTML code** of the page from the API response, ready to be analyzed.                                                        |
| üîß **Format & Isolate Price Block** | This custom code node filters or extracts just the **pricing section** (e.g., plan names, \$ amounts) from the HTML to compare later.                        |

> ‚úÖ **Advantage for Beginners**: You don‚Äôt need to manually visit or inspect the site. Everything is automated and updated behind the scenes.

---

## üü° **SECTION 2: Check If the Price Has Changed**

### üîç Compare New Data with the Last Saved One

| üß© Nodes Involved            | üí¨ Description                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ---------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| üìÑ **Read Last Saved Price** | This reads from a **Google Sheet** that stores the **last known pricing data**. This becomes your reference point for comparison.                                                                       |
| üîÅ **Has Price Changed?**    | A simple **IF condition** compares the current scraped pricing to the previously saved one. If the content is **exactly the same**, nothing happens. If it's **different**, it moves to the alert flow. |

> ‚úÖ **Advantage for Beginners**: No need for complex logic. n8n handles the comparison using a basic condition node.

---

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

## üß†üíº Title:

**Competitor Pricing Page Monitor ‚Äî Automated Alerts Using n8n + Bright Data**

This workflow automatically **monitors a competitor‚Äôs pricing page**, **detects changes**, and sends an **alert email** while keeping a record in **Google Sheets**. Perfect for businesses tracking market moves or SaaS competitors!

---

## üü¢ **SECTION 1: Fetch the Latest Pricing Info**

### üì° Scheduled Scraping Using Bright Data

| üß© Nodes Involved                   | üí¨ Description                                                                                                                                               |
| ----------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| üïí **Check Pricing Every Hour**     | This **Schedule Trigger** runs your workflow automatically (e.g., every hour). You don‚Äôt have to manually check the website.                                 |
| üåê **Fetch Page via Bright Data**   | Uses **Bright Data Web Unlocker API** to bypass bot protections and fetch the HTML of the pricing page from a competitor site (e.g., Wix, Squarespace, etc). |
| üßæ **Extract HTML Content**         | This node pulls out the actual **HTML code** of the page from the API response, ready to be analyzed.                                                        |
| üîß **Format & Isolate Price Block** | This custom code node filters or extracts just the **pricing section** (e.g., plan names, \$ amounts) from the HTML to compare later.                        |

> ‚úÖ **Advantage for Beginners**: You don‚Äôt need to manually visit or inspect the site. Everything is automated and updated behind the scenes.

---

## üü° **SECTION 2: Check If the Price Has Changed**

### üîç Compare New Data with the Last Saved One

| üß© Nodes Involved            | üí¨ Description                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ---------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| üìÑ **Read Last Saved Price** | This reads from a **Google Sheet** that stores the **last known pricing data**. This becomes your reference point for comparison.                                                                       |
| üîÅ **Has Price Changed?**    | A simple **IF condition** compares the current scraped pricing to the previously saved one. If the content is **exactly the same**, nothing happens. If it's **different**, it moves to the alert flow. |

> ‚úÖ **Advantage for Beginners**: No need for complex logic. n8n handles the comparison using a basic condition node.

---

## üî¥ **SECTION 3: Alert & Save New Price**

### üö® Notify + Update Sheet

| üß© Nodes Involved                    | üí¨ Description                                                                                                                                          |
| ------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ‚ûñ **No Change Detected ‚Äì Stop**      | If no changes were found, this does nothing and exits. Keeps your flow efficient.                                                                       |
| üìÑ **Update Stored Price**           | If the price **has changed**, it writes the new value to the **Google Sheet** so future comparisons are accurate.                                       |
| üìß **Send Price Change Alert Email** | This node sends a **professional email** (via Gmail) to alert you or your team about the pricing update. The email includes the date and the page link. |

> ‚úÖ **Advantage for Beginners**: No need to monitor email manually or check sheets. You‚Äôre notified only when something meaningful happens!

---

## üñºÔ∏è üìä VISUAL WORKFLOW SUMMARY

```mermaid
graph TD;
  A[üïí Schedule Trigger] --> B[üåê Fetch via Bright Data];
  B --> C[üßæ Extract HTML];
  C --> D[üîß Extract Pricing];
  D --> E[üìÑ Read Last Price from Sheet];
  E --> F{üîÅ Has Price Changed?};
  F -- Yes --> G[üìÑ Update Sheet];
  G --> H[üìß Send Alert Email];
  F -- No --> I[‚ûñ Do Nothing];
```

---

## üåü WHY THIS WORKFLOW IS POWERFUL (EVEN FOR BEGINNERS):

| Feature                  | Benefit                                                   |
| ------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------------- |
| ‚úÖ No Code                | Drag-and-drop automation ‚Äî no dev experience needed       |
| üîê Unlocks Sites         | Bright Data handles websites that block scrapers          |
| üìà Business Intelligence | Stay competitive by tracking market pricing in real-time  |
| üí¨ Real-time Alerts      | Act fast with Gmail notifications when pricing changes    |
| üìù Data Logging          | Google Sheets keeps a historical log of every price point |

---

## I‚Äôll receive a tiny commission if you join Bright Data through this link‚Äîthanks for fueling more free content!

### https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
